oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from Pvt. Virigil Metcalf to his mother
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Metcalf served in Co. A, 47th Engineer Battn. His mother was Mrs. W. M. Boling of Maryville, Tennesee although Metcalf was from McMinn County. In this typewritten letter to his mother he comments that he is practicing on his new typewriter. Metcalf's unit eventually becomes a transportation unit and they served in France from July, 1918 to June, 1919.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
